text: Erling Brøndum (11 July 1930 – 4 August 2017) was a Danish journalist and politician. He began at Bornholms Tidende as a reporter, and at age 26, was named chief editor. After fourteen years as the publication's editor, Brøndum joined the staff of the Horsens Folkeblad. In 1973, Poul Hartling named Brøndum Minister of Defence. He left the post in 1975, and returned to Horsens Folkeblad and the Aalborg Stiftstidende. Brøndum died in Copenhagen, Denmark on 4 August 2017 at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Danish politicians Category:Danish writers Category:Danish journalists
